bible.derived: Masoretic Text and the Westcott and Hort Greek text

translations.name: Ferrar Fenton Bible
translations.description: Work on the Ferrar Fenton Bible was begun in 1853 by a London businessman Ferrar Fenton (1832–1920). The complete Bible was first published in 1903, though parts were published in separate volumes during the preceding 11 years. Fenton spent approximately fifty years working on his translation, with his sole goal “to study the Bible absolutely in its original languages, to ascertain what its writers actually said and thought.”
